questions.question: This act placed a tax on all papers, such as legal documents and newspapers.
What debt did British Parliament decide the colonists should pay?

choices.answer: The French and Indian War debt

questions.question: What was the phrase that colonists used to protest the unfair taxes?
The Declaration of Independence states that the government should...

choices.answer: protect the rights of the people.

questions.question: The Declaration of Independence listed grievances against...
This act gave the British East India Company exclusive rights to sell tea in the colonies.
In response to the Tea Act, colonists dumped tea into the Boston Harbor.  This is known as...
These acts were passed as punishment for the Boston Tea Party.
Who wrote the Declaration of Independence?
Because of the taxes, colonists refused to buy British goods.  This is called a ...
The Declaration of Independence states...

choices.answer: all men are created equal and have unalienable  rights.
the people should do as the government says.

questions.question: The Intolerable Acts...

choices.answer: closed the Boston Harbor and imposed the Quartering Act.
opened the Boston Harbor and taxed the colonists.
closed the Boston Harbor and arrested colonist.

questions.question: What economic policy increased tensions between the Colonies and Great Britain?
Life, Liberty and the Pursuit of Happiness are examples of unalienable rights which are rights that...

choices.answer: People recieve from their Creater and cannot be taken away
Americans recognized after troops spent the Winter at Valley Forge
Americans gained once they come of age to participate in an election
People received after the British signed the Treaty of Paris in 1783

questions.question: What significant battle did Wentworth Cheswell fight in during the American Revolution
During the Winter at Valley Forge, the following were conditions the soldiers encountered

choices.answer: limited food, clothing, disease, starvation, lack of shelter, harsh weather
limited shelter, but lots of food and clothing

questions.question: Which excerpt from the Declaration best demonstrates why colonists felt their right to representation was being denied

choices.answer: Quartering large bodies of armed troops among us.
Called together legislative bodies at place unusual and distinct
Depriving us of Trial by Jury
For imposing taxes on us without our consent

questions.question: What is significant about the Battle of Yorktown

choices.answer: Turning point of the American Revolution

questions.question: What position did George Washington serve in during the American Revolution

choices.answer: Author of the Declaration of Independence
First President of the United States

questions.question: What is the correct chronological order of the following events: Stamp Act, Boston Massacre, Boston Tea Party

choices.answer: Boston Massacre, Boston Tea Party and Stamp Act
Boston Tea Party, Boston Massacre and Stamp Act
Stamp Act, Boston Massacre and Boston Tea Party
Stamp Act, Boston Tea Party and Boston Massacre

questions.question: An example of civic virtue is?

choices.answer: saving money in preparation for a future emergency
trading supplies with Britain to make a profit

questions.question: Which statement would most likely be said by Wentworth Cheswell?

choices.answer: I must gain my freedom, therefore I must fight for the British
I will risk my life to spy on British troops
No one deserves more respect than George Washington
My community needs to hear about the approaching British, I must warn them!

questions.question: Which statement would most likely be said by James Armistead

choices.answer: I must gain my freedom, therefore I must fight for the British
I will risk my life to spy on British troops
No one deserves more respect than George Washington
My community needs to hear about the approaching British, I must warn them!

questions.question: Haym Soloman was significant to the American Revolution because?

choices.answer: trained George Washington's undisciplined army at Valley Forge
Contributed a significant amount of funds to the Patriot cause
Convinced  France and Spain to send the colonies weapons and troops
Published pamphlets that motivated colonists to enlist in the Army

questions.question: Which of these is a grievance from the Declaration of Independence?

choices.answer: Colonists born in America were prohibited from holding elected office
Colonists were not eligible to become officers in the British Army
Colonists were forced to quarter troops in their homes
Colonists were required to serve a year in their colony's militia

questions.question: Why is the battle of Saratoga considered a turning point in the Revolutionary War?

choices.answer: The British victory extended the fighting for another year
It marked the beginning of a steady decline in British military superiority
The American defeat led many soldiers to leave the Continental Army
The American victory convinced France to Ally with the United States

In the years before the signing of the Declaration, colonists grew resentful of Britain because of what?

choices.answer: Restrictions  placed on the education of women
Limitations set on religious freedom in the colonies
Opposition to being taxed without representation

questions.question: Life, Liberty and the pursuit of happiness are examples of unalienable rights, which are rights that -

choices.answer: People conceive from their creator and cannot be taken away
Americans gain once they are of age to participate in an election
